primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God calls and empowers a people to be set apart (holy) for His exclusive use through the sacrificial work of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ’s resurrection power comes into our lives.
God in the form of Jesus Christ has come into this world... to make everything right again.
For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they might be sanctified.
What makes you holy? Not just that you’re moral but that you belong to God.

zender.identificatie: The Father / The Holy God of Leviticus
tekstueel_bewijs: He who called you is holy
You call on a Father who judges each person’s work impartially
the grace to be brought to you
you were redeemed from the empty way of life
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is primarily the Receiver of grace, then the Subject of the secondary program.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ’s resurrection power comes into our lives.
You will not be able to live the Christian life unless you think.
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Subject (Redeemer) and the Helper (Power source).

tekstueel_bewijs: the evil desires you had when you lived in ignorance
the claustrophobia of living for ourselves
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'spiraling down' and an 'empty way of life' that requires the 'precious blood of Christ' to break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having been bought, now lives a life of 'not living for self' but for God and neighbor.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that holiness (belonging) precedes and produces morality (action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God had to practically clobber Peter over the head
Jesus Christ’s blood... has been shed for you
God looks at someone who is moral but not holy
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You no longer live for yourself
You have to use your head

voorbeelden: every part of your life has to be holy
I want to delight in him
Anything that would bring joy to the heart
Think! It’s a lack of thinking that gives you a lack of peace.
Think out the implications of your faith
Jesus Christ’s resurrection power comes into our lives
Why is it possible to be holy?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on transforming the 'WANT' (motivation) through 'SAVOIR' (thinking about the Gospel) to enable 'POUVOIR' (power).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (mere morality) to S2 (the problem of self) to S1 (belonging via Christ's sacrifice).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ 'sanctifies himself' (S1) to move the believer from ~S1/S2 into S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is seen as an ontological 'empty way of life' and 'claustrophobia'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses 'Call' and 'Command' language, it structurally grounds all human action in the prior, finished work of Christ and the indwelling power of the resurrection.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: There is a matter of the will. There is an engagement.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they might be sanctified.
It’s not necessary to keep the Levitical ceremonial laws... those things have been all fulfilled in Christ.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David's mighty men are used as an example of devotion, but the sermon immediately pivots to Christ as the one who truly gave His life.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the 'Mighty Man' who fought through enemy lines (death) to bring us the water of life.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'mere morality' and motivation through awe.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a fruit of Justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Mind' to the 'Heart' is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Fearing God' and 'God as Father' is acknowledged but resolved through the 'Awe' definition.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ’s blood... has been shed for you.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is an 'empty way of life' that requires 'precious blood' to redeem.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of the 'Sanctification' narrative, preventing the 'Call to Holiness' from devolving into a 'To-Do' list.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too strongly with the 'Mighty Men' as heroes of devotion.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Identify with the 'thirsty David' or the 'Receiver' of Christ's risk.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Explicitly state that Christ is the ultimate 'Mighty Man' who risked all for us.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain, as it grounds the Vouloir.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect 'Thinking' more explicitly to the work of the Holy Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-based exhortation. It avoids moralism by redefining the goal (holiness as belonging) and the means (thinking upon the Gospel).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Mighty Men' story's pathos; Greimas reveals that Christ is the true Subject of that story's deep structure.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the word 'sober'; Greimas shows how 'soberness' functions as a Helper for the Subject's competence.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'morality' is often a false Object that replaces 'God' in the narrative axis of desire.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by making Christ's self-sanctification the engine for the believer's sanctification.
